revised_title: Hierarchical Packaging and Provisioning in Plant Reproduction: Ecological Correlates and Phylogenetic Constraints
tldr: This article explores the hierarchical packaging and provisioning strategies in plant reproduction, considering aspects such as seed size, number, and the relationship between female and male components. The author develops models to understand how selection operates on these components and how they interact with each other, providing tools for studying plant reproductive design and ecology.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
